comments.author: LoyceV
comments.body: I have to ask: for the past 2 years, I've seen you take larger and larger loans. It looks like you're getting yourself in a deeper and deeper debt, and only governments can keep that up forever. I've probably said it before, but aren't you better off spending a bit less, saving up for $1000, and never paying interest again?

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: Quote from: LoyceV on November 01, 2023, 03:08:35 PMI have to ask: for the past 2 years, I've seen you take larger and larger loans. It looks like you're getting yourself in a deeper and deeper debt, and only governments can keep that up forever. I've probably said it before, but aren't you better off spending a bit less, saving up for $1000, and never paying interest again?You're asking the wrong question - "How's your ban evasion defense going?" is what you should be asking...

comments.author: HedgeFx
comments.created_time: November 01, 2023, 07:18:14 PMLast edit: November 01, 2023, 08:56:02 PM by HedgeFx
comments.body: Hallo LoyceV,Than for kindly suggestion, but is not properly as you think. I’ve a lot of different coin staked on more Exchanges. Also I’ve a lot of FUN token staked on freebitcoin. Each loan I take end when some of my staked investments end: so i be sure to have money for repay my debt at any case. As l wrote on other discussion (https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5466577.msg62835668#msg62835668) I use loans for my trading activities: this is a sort of money management, that prevents me take too much risks by trading too much money . Everyone could be a good trader, but without money management everyone will be a loser. My results are really good, but I think that the key of my success is money management.Each time i had good results I repaid in advance and started a new loan: this happened a lot of times . Other time results wasn’t so good, so I have to wait stakes deadline for repayment. By taking loans i will be sure that i will never risk more than I can. And I known a lot of person that lose money because they invested more than they could (especially when they initially had some profits).Other about me: in real life I have a good job and just 4 months ago a i bought my first electric car ( I made a post about it on Italian board. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5444827.0). Paid in cash , no debt: at least in real life    Quote from: LoyceV on November 01, 2023, 03:08:35 PMI have to ask: for the past 2 years, I've seen you take larger and larger loans. It looks like you're getting yourself in a deeper and deeper debt, and only governments can keep that up forever. I've probably said it before, but aren't you better off spending a bit less, saving up for $1000, and never paying interest again?
